# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)

## Load and manipulate data
```{r}
# Load coffee dataset
coffee <- coffee_data %>% 
  mutate()

# Convert `ne_countries()` to class `sf` - maybe not necessary
sf_countries <- ne_countries(returnclass = 'sf')

# Merge `world` with `coffee` datasets
sf_coffee <- left_join(x = world, y = coffee, by = "name_long") %>% 
  filter(coffee_production_2016 > 1)
```

## Create Basic Plots
```{r}
# Plotting two columns
plot(sf_coffee[c("coffee_production_2016", "coffee_production_2017")])
```

```{r}
# Plotting one column
plot(sf_coffee["coffee_production_2016"])
```
